\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Fluid Property evaluation (general)}
\label{\detokenize{fluid_properties_rp:fluid-property-evaluation-general}}\label{\detokenize{fluid_properties_rp::doc}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
At the moment REFPROP (NIST) or CoolProp can be used for property evaluations of
pure fluids and mixures, TREND (RU Bochum) usage  will be included in near future. They will have to be installed on your system!

\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{fluid_properties_rp:module-fluid_properties_rp}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!fluid\_properties\_rp@\spxentry{fluid\_properties\_rp}}\index{fluid\_properties\_rp@\spxentry{fluid\_properties\_rp}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Functions to obtain fluid properties from REFPROP or CoolProp using the low
level interface. (Set \_props accordingly)
Mainly used for thermodynamic cycle calculations.
So far for several combinations of (input) parameters in the single\sphinxhyphen{}phase or
saturated regime. For the ouput it can be mostly chosen, whether transport
properties are als returned, besides the thermodynamiic properties.
Functions are also vectorized by hand (Name:”…\_v). Physical exergies can be calculated for a state of known h and p.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Standard units: SI (J, kg, Pa, K,…)

\sphinxAtStartPar
changes 30.11.2022

\sphinxAtStartPar
@author: atakan
\index{T\_prop\_sat() (in module fluid\_properties\_rp)@\spxentry{T\_prop\_sat()}\spxextra{in module fluid\_properties\_rp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{fluid_properties_rp:fluid_properties_rp.T_prop_sat}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fluid\_properties\_rp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{T\_prop\_sat}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{temp}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{fluid}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{composition}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}1.0{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{option}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{units}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{21}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{props}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}REFPROP\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Saturation state properties at given temperature for a certain fluid (mixture).
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{temp}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} Temperature in K.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fluid}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{an AbstractState in coolprop}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{a fluid in REFPROP.}}) \textendash{} 

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{alle} \textendash{}
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{includes:  properies in saturated state at given pressure p}
\sphinxAtStartPar
of liquid (0,:) and vapor(1,:),

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
1: T, p, h, v,s, q
0:  T p h v s q cp, viscosity, thermal conductivity, Pr, kinematic viscosity
all in SI units.


\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
numpy array (2,4)

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{hp() (in module fluid\_properties\_rp)@\spxentry{hp()}\spxextra{in module fluid\_properties\_rp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{fluid_properties_rp:fluid_properties_rp.hp}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{fluid\_properties\_rp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{hp}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{h}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{p}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{fluid}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{composition}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}1.0{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{option}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{1}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{units}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{21}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{props}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{\textquotesingle{}REFPROP\textquotesingle{}}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Properties needed for integration at given  values of pressure
and specific enthalpy, single phase.
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{h}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} specific enthalpy in J/kg.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} pressure in Pa.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{fluid}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{an AbstractState in coolprop.}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{fluid name in Refprop}}) \textendash{} 

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{option}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{integer}}) \textendash{} if 0 also transport properties will be calculated
(not yet implemented for REFPROP)
with option 1 : T,p,h,v,s,x is calculated

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{units}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{integer}}) \textendash{} units in Refprop (imposrtant: must be SI and mass based (kg, Pa etc.))

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{alle} \textendash{} if option = 0 it includes: T, p , quality, specific enthalpy,entropy
densities,
viscosities, cp , conductivity,phase prandtl\sphinxhyphen{}number
at the defined state (p,h)
all in SI units.

\sphinxAtStartPar
if option =1: it is compatible to the high level output
T,p,h,v,s,x.


\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
numpy array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\sphinxAtStartPar

\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstylestrong{alle} \textendash{} if option = 0 it includes: T, p , quality, specific enthalpy,entropy
densities,
viscosities, cp , conductivity,phase prandtl\sphinxhyphen{}number
at the defined state (p,h)
all in SI units.

\sphinxAtStartPar
if option =1: it is compatible to the high level output
T,p,h,v,s,x.


\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
numpy array

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}


\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Heat Exchanger evaluation}
\label{\detokenize{heat_exchanger:module-heat_exchanger}}\label{\detokenize{heat_exchanger:heat-exchanger-evaluation}}\label{\detokenize{heat_exchanger::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!heat\_exchanger@\spxentry{heat\_exchanger}}\index{heat\_exchanger@\spxentry{heat\_exchanger}!module@\spxentry{module}}\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{heat_exchanger:module-0}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!heat\_exchanger@\spxentry{heat\_exchanger}}\index{heat\_exchanger@\spxentry{heat\_exchanger}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Heat exchanger base class
and counterflow heat exchnager class are introduced
For the first, only the maximum possible heat flow rate s evaluated.
For the counterflow heat exchanger at the moment the boundary value problem
is solved with constant overall heat transfer coefficient  along the axial
coordinate is implemented, together with some graphical output.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Fluid properties stem from REFPROP or CoolProp, the low\sphinxhyphen{}level interface is used.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Planned:
\sphinxhyphen{}the convection coefficienets along the axial coordinate
shall be evaluated using appropriate Nu\sphinxhyphen{}correlations
\sphinxhyphen{} optimization will be implemented (Entropy minimization)
\sphinxhyphen{} perhaps pressure drop will be implemented to the bvp

\sphinxAtStartPar
if nothing else given: counterflow/double\sphinxhyphen{}pipe
if nothing else is said given: steady state

\sphinxAtStartPar
Created on Sun Oct  2 16:27:20 2022

\sphinxAtStartPar
@author: atakan
\index{counterflow\_hex (class in heat\_exchanger)@\spxentry{counterflow\_hex}\spxextra{class in heat\_exchanger}}

\index{bc() (heat\_exchanger.counterflow\_hex method)@\spxentry{bc()}\spxextra{heat\_exchanger.counterflow\_hex method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{heat_exchanger:heat_exchanger.counterflow_hex.bc}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{bc}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{ha}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{hb}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
two boundary conditions for bvp\sphinxhyphen{}solver (scipy\sphinxhyphen{}optimize) needed
here: the enthalpies of the inner fluid at x=0 and the enthalpy of
the outer fluid at the end of the heat exchanger at x=length
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{ha}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy array}}) \textendash{} enthalpies of the inner fluid along the x\sphinxhyphen{}coordinate.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{hb}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy array}}) \textendash{} enthalpies of the outer fluid along the x\sphinxhyphen{}coordinate.

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
the difference to the prescribed entrance conditions, should both
get zero, if succesful.

\sphinxlineitem{Return type}
\sphinxAtStartPar
numpy array of length 2

\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}

\index{energy() (heat\_exchanger.counterflow\_hex method)@\spxentry{energy()}\spxextra{heat\_exchanger.counterflow\_hex method}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{heat_exchanger:heat_exchanger.counterflow_hex.energy}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{energy}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{x}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{h}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
energy balance for solving the boundary value problem
couples the energy changes of each fluid with the convective heat
transfer between both fluids.
At the moment the convection coefficient from the heat exchanger
is used;
this shall be evaluated later as a function of local
heat exchanger parameters.

\sphinxAtStartPar
output: both changes in enthalpy in x\sphinxhyphen{}direction
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{depends on heat\sphinxhyphen{}exchanger variables:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
fluids (fluid\sphinxhyphen{}names)
U: heat transfer coefficient W/m2/K
mass\_flows: mass flow rates kg/s
perimeter: circumference of tube m

\end{description}

\sphinxAtStartPar
function hp returns an array, the first value is temperature

\end{fulllineitems}

\end{description}\end{quote}

\chapter{Mixture search, Simple heat\sphinxhyphen{}pump (plotting)}
\label{\detokenize{mixture_search:module-mixture_search}}\label{\detokenize{mixture_search:mixture-search-simple-heat-pump-plotting}}\label{\detokenize{mixture_search::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!mixture\_search@\spxentry{mixture\_search}}\index{mixture\_search@\spxentry{mixture\_search}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Simple calculation of heat pump states for multinerary mixtures (using Refprop)
mainly for visualization of temperature and enthalpy levels for different
pressure levels and slight superheatig after evaporation.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Created on Tue Nov 22 14:55:50 2022

\sphinxAtStartPar
@author: atakan
\index{find\_comp() (in module mixture\_search)@\spxentry{find\_comp()}\spxextra{in module mixture\_search}}

\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{mixture\_search.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{find\_comp}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{x}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{x0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{p}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{110000.0}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{T}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{289.0}}}{}

find the ternary composition for given compressor inlet T \& p
function for scipy.root

\sphinxstepscope


\chapter{Heat Pump Cycle}
\label{\detokenize{heat_pump_rp:module-heat_pump_rp}}\label{\detokenize{heat_pump_rp:heat-pump-cycle}}\label{\detokenize{heat_pump_rp::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!heat\_pump\_rp@\spxentry{heat\_pump\_rp}}\index{heat\_pump\_rp@\spxentry{heat\_pump\_rp}!module@\spxentry{module}}
\sphinxAtStartPar
Heat pump cycle incl. heat transfer.

\sphinxAtStartPar
Calculate the pressures and the mass flow rate to fulfill the heat transfer
canditions for given (constant!) temperatures of the heat sink and source
x=1 before the compressor with isentropic efficienc eta and x=0 entering
the throttle.
This is done by root finding for a fluid, taking the properties from CoolProp
Will be used for sensitivity analysis and optimization (hopefully).

\sphinxAtStartPar
Created on Tue Feb 23 17:15:50 2021

\sphinxAtStartPar
@author: atakan
\index{check\_bound() (in module heat\_pump\_rp)@\spxentry{check\_bound()}\spxextra{in module heat\_pump\_rp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{heat_pump_rp:heat_pump_rp.check_bound}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{heat\_pump\_rp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{check\_bound}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{p}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{bounds}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\end{fulllineitems}

\index{heat\_pump\_ht() (in module heat\_pump\_rp)@\spxentry{heat\_pump\_ht()}\spxextra{in module heat\_pump\_rp}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{heat_pump_rp:heat_pump_rp.heat_pump_ht}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{heat\_pump\_rp.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{heat\_pump\_ht}}}{\emph{\DUrole{n}{p}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{eta}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{U}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{A}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{T\_s}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{working\_fluid}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{composition}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{{[}1.0{]}}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{rootfind}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{True}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{optim}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{False}}, \emph{\DUrole{n}{bounds}\DUrole{o}{=}\DUrole{default_value}{None}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Heat pump cycle with isothermal source and sink, x=0 after condenser.

\sphinxAtStartPar
x=1 entering the compressor. For optimizing the two working fluid pressures
or calculating states, COPs etc
\begin{quote}\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Parameters}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{p}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy.array}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{3 floats}}) \textendash{} with the pressures of evaporator and condenser and  the
mass flow rate (all SI Pa, kg/s.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{eta}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{float}}) \textendash{} compressor efficienvy (isentropic).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{U}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy.array}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{3floats}}) \textendash{} mean overall heat ransfer coefficients for evaporator, condenser(gas)
condenser two\sphinxhyphen{}phase (W/m2/K).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{A}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy.array}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{2 floats}}) \textendash{} areas of evaporatorand condenser (m2).

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{T\_s}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{numpy.array}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{2 floats}}) \textendash{} secondary fluid temperatures low and high in K.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{working\_fluid}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{coolprop}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{ or }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Refprop fluid}}) \textendash{} DESCRIPTION.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{rootfind}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional.}}) \textendash{} are we finding the root? (T\sphinxhyphen{}differences according to heat exchanger size)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{optim}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{Boolean}}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{, }}\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{optional}}) \textendash{} if true: output for optimization
if false: output of several properties. The default is True.

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleliteralstrong{\sphinxupquote{bounds}} (\sphinxstyleliteralemphasis{\sphinxupquote{not yet implemented}}) \textendash{} 

\end{itemize}

\sphinxlineitem{Returns}
\sphinxAtStartPar
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{if rootfind == True} \textendash{} array with three differences of energy balances

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{if optim == True} \textendash{} rational efficiency (for optimization)

\item {} 
\sphinxAtStartPar
\sphinxstyleemphasis{if False} \textendash{} state: array with all calculated states (T,p,x,h,s,rho …)
q\_w: all specific energies transfered (J/kg)
A\_hg: heat exchanger Area until condensation
cop: COP of the cycle
cop\_carnot: Carnot\sphinxhyphen{}COP for the tempereatures of condenser and
evaporator (superheating is neglected)
eta\_rational: ratio of the latter two COPs
p\_compr: Compressor Power (W)
q\_h\_dot: Heat flow rate at high T (W).

\end{itemize}


\end{description}\end{quote}

\end{fulllineitems}
